StringTable.String: Our mastery of the energy fields needed to create and maintain shields has resulted in a couple interesting new technologies, capable of interfering with enemy shield systems, or massively shielding friendly units within range.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenses_Name
StringTable.String: Point Defenses

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenses_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenses_Dec
StringTable.String: An array of tiny computer controlled railguns that track and destroy incoming missiles, point defense systems are unparalleled at protecting ships and starbases from missile attacks, though still aren't terribly helpful at defending against other classes of weapons.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseOptimization1_Name
StringTable.String: Smart Point Defenses

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseOptimization1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases point defense strength.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: A careful analysis of various missile performance envelopes has led us to adjust the firing patterns of our point defense systems, which should make them more effective.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseOptimization2_Name
StringTable.String: Low Cost Point Defenses

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseOptimization2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces point defense cost.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: The sensor and tracking equipment our point defense systems use are fairly specialized pieces of equipment that were initially quite rare and costly. Now that we've dedicated a lot of effort to building point defenses, the price of those systems is starting to come down.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseOptimization3_Name
StringTable.String: Point Defense Miniaturization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseOptimization3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces point defense mass.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: The slugs fired by point defenses don't need to be large and were limited by the fact that we could only build railguns so small. Now that we can build more compact railguns, we should see significant weight savings for all our point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasures_Name
StringTable.String: Counter Measures

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasures_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasures_Dec
StringTable.String: By deploying electronic countermeasures which interfere with and confuse incoming missile attacks, we've greatly increased the survivability of our ships and starbases. Against missiles at least. Hard to confuse a laser.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasureFocus1_Name
StringTable.String: Adaptive Counter Measures

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasureFocus1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases point defense strength.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasureFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: There's always a generational game of leap frog being played between missile designers and ECM designers, but we believe our latest algorithms have given us the leg up on the bad guys this time.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasureFocus2_Name
StringTable.String: Counter Measure Manufacturing

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasureFocus2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces point defense cost.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasureFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our earliest attempts at ECM suites were heavily customizable, requiring a great deal of fine tuning to perform well. Now that we know what works, we can automate much more of the manufacturing and installation process.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasureFocus3_Name
StringTable.String: Low Mass Counter Measures

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasureFocus3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces point defense mass.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasureFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Our first ECM suites were cobbled together from a half dozen different processors and transmitters. We've since streamlined those into a single unit which weighs much less.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDroneSentrySystems_Name
StringTable.String: Drone Sentry Systems

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDroneSentrySystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDroneSentrySystems_Dec
StringTable.String: By installing our point defense systems on drone platforms that orbit our ships at a distance, we add a valuable extra layer of protection against missile attacks.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDroneSystemMastery1_Name
StringTable.String: Master Point Defense Assembly

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDroneSystemMastery1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces point defense cost.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDroneSystemMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: To be fair, only a few of our drone systems have ever actually shot each other in combat situations. But by minimizing that just a little more, we should be able to make our point defenses a little more cost effective, albeit less funny.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDroneSystemMastery2_Name
StringTable.String: High Density Point Defenses

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDroneSystemMastery2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces point defense mass.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDroneSystemMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: Once we realized point defense drones don't need much personal space, we were able to start packing them in a lot tighter.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArreonMissileDefenseTech_Name
StringTable.String: Arreon Missile Defense

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArreonMissileDefenseTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate point defense systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArreonMissileDefenseTech_Dec
StringTable.String: The ultimate in point defense technology, featuring the latest generation of micro-drones, armed with railguns, ECM and smart chafe, capable of filling the space around a ship with a cloud of debris so thick no enemy missiles are likely to survive.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseSupportSystem_Name
StringTable.String: Point Defense Support

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseSupportSystem_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of point defense support systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseSupportSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: Our experience working with small scale point defenses has led to a type of long-range missile tracking system which should enhance the point defense capabilities of an entire fleet.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseAugmentation_Name
StringTable.String: Point Defense Augmentation

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseAugmentation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved point defense support systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseAugmentation_Dec
StringTable.String: Wide-area missile disruptors enhance the effectiveness of our existing countermeasures, adding a much needed layer of extra missile security to entire fleets.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseManipulation_Name
StringTable.String: Point Defense Manipulation

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseManipulation_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced point defense support systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseManipulation_Dec
StringTable.String: Our mastery of point defense technologies has led to the development of fleet-wide drone systems. Additionally, our fleets can now be equipped with point defense disruptors, essentially a type of counter-countermeasure, which should greatly boost the effectiveness of our own missile attacks.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorSystems_Name
StringTable.String: Armor Systems

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorSystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved armor systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: A big lump of ultra-dense material remains an effective, if unsubtle, method of protection from modern space-based weaponry.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorOptimization1_Name
StringTable.String: Reinforced Armor

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorOptimization1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases armor strength.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorOptimization1_Dec
StringTable.String: A simple mistake by one of our fabricators resulted in a set of armor panels marginally denser and more resilient than we'd seen before. It took us a long time to replicate that mistake, but now that we have, our ships should be a little tougher to kill.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorOptimization2_Name
StringTable.String: Low-Cost Armor

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorOptimization2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces armor cost.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorOptimization2_Dec
StringTable.String: One of the biggest challenges with armor manufacturing was simply the logistics of moving rare and heavy resources and materials around. Now that we've got our supply chain sorted out, we can expect to see some nice cost savings.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorOptimization3_Name
StringTable.String: Armor Miniaturization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorOptimization3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces armor mass.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorOptimization3_Dec
StringTable.String: By its very nature, armor is always going to be a fairly mass-intensive way of protection. That said, we can do a few things to improve the precision and fit of armor plating, which should cut down on weight a bit.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDurantiumCompositeTech_Name
StringTable.String: Durantium Composite

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDurantiumCompositeTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced armor systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDurantiumCompositeTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Experiments have revealed that when certain materials are stacked in specific arrangements, they have a synergistic effect on the strength of their neighbors when exposed to compressive forces, greatly magnifying their damage absorption potential. We call these new composites Durantium, and they should tremendously increase the survivability of our ships.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorFocus1_Name
StringTable.String: Armor Lamination

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorFocus1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Increases armor strength.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorFocus1_Dec
StringTable.String: A careful study of some battle-damaged ships has revealed previously unknown weaknesses in our armor systems. Basically, we know why some of them were cracking in half now. We'll do something about that right away.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorFocus2_Name
StringTable.String: Armor Manufacturing Focus

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorFocus2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces armor cost.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorFocus2_Dec
StringTable.String: If the troops ask, it's not that our armor is now cheap. It's that we've found a more efficient way of manufacturing it. But yes, it is pretty cheap.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorFocus3_Name
StringTable.String: Armor Mass Reduction

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorFocus3_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces armor mass.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorFocus3_Dec
StringTable.String: Some experiments with the arrangement of our Durantium composites has revealed that we can get away with slightly less dense materials at certain layers with no impact to the armor's effectiveness.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesKanviumLaminateTech_Name
StringTable.String: Kanvium Laminate

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesKanviumLaminateTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of exotic armor systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesKanviumLaminateTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Kanvium armor systems use a new type of lamination which, upon impact, causes surrounding materials to partially fluidize, deforming to absorb energy in a recoverable way. Impacts are spread out over a much larger area, increasing the effectiveness of the armor. After the impact, the armor flows back into its original shape, minimizing the risk posed by repeat hits.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorMastery1_Name
StringTable.String: Master Armorers

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorMastery1_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces armor cost.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorMastery1_Dec
StringTable.String: With modern armoring systems, the design of the armor informs the shape of the ship as much as the other way around; properly armoring a ship is a complicated trade off between armorer and ship designer. It's an art essentially, and it's one that we have mastered.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorMastery2_Name
StringTable.String: High Density Armor

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorMastery2_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Reduces armor mass.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorMastery2_Dec
StringTable.String: We've created and shredded countless generations of armor, and worn out entire test ranges with our target practice. On a weight basis, our armor systems are now as efficient as they can possibly be.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesZeroPointArmorTech_Name
StringTable.String: Zero Point Armor

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesZeroPointArmorTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of the ultimate armor systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesZeroPointArmorTech_Dec
StringTable.String: Zero point armor is a thin layer of material we have a hard time proving exists, only knowing of it by the effect that it has. Upon impact, it appears to essentially tap into the zero-point energy of the surrounding quantum vacuum, directing all that energy to repulse any incoming projectiles. It's almost impossibly tough, we can prove that much at least.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorSupportSystems_Name
StringTable.String: Armor Support Systems

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorSupportSystems_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of armor support systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorSupportSystems_Dec
StringTable.String: In the factory, we've begun producing armor plating with a variety of force field based technologies. By adapting some of those into long-range, ship-based emitters, we're able to create a hardening effect in material at a considerable distance. This technology could be used to make every ship in a fleet substantially more durable.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorEnhancement_Name
StringTable.String: Armor Enhancement

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorEnhancement_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of improved armor support systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorEnhancement_Dec
StringTable.String: The fields that we use to generate hardening effects at a distance have 27 different "poles" which can be cycled repeatedly through, changing the alignment of the hardening effects in the affected material; generating substantially stronger, more resilient materials.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesIntegrityFieldProjection_Name
StringTable.String: Integrity Field Projection

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesIntegrityFieldProjection_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows construction of advanced armor support systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesIntegrityFieldProjection_Dec
StringTable.String: Our latest generation of armoring fields no longer just generate hardening effects at a distance, but can now induce material fluidization and shape recovery effects as well. These new Integrity Fields can make every ship in a fleet invulnerable to all but the most powerful attacks.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCommunicationsTech_Name
StringTable.String: Communications

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCommunicationsTech_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Allows research of communications technologies.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCommunicationsTech_Dec
StringTable.String: We've already seen glimpses of evidence that we're not alone in this galaxy. This presents an incredible danger to us, but also perhaps an opportunity. But also, let's stress again, danger.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesInterstellarSpecialization_Name
StringTable.String: Interstellar Specialization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesInterstellarSpecialization_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we have a bit of experience sending ships out into the darkness and having most of them come back, we've come up with a number of ways to improve our equipment and navigational techniques.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesIonOptimization_Name
StringTable.String: Ion Optimization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesIonOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we've seen them in widescale use, we've identified a number of ways we can make our new Ion Drive systems more efficient.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesWarpFieldFocus_Name
StringTable.String: Warp Field Focus

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesWarpFieldFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: Warp field technology is incredibly complicated, and has in more than a few cases caused a researcher's brains to melt a little bit. But now that we have some experience working with them, we've identified a number of ways to improve their design.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesHyperwarpMastery_Name
StringTable.String: Hyperwarp Mastery

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesHyperwarpMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Our ships are the envy of the galaxy and our engineers heralded as heroes wherever they go. Fortunately they don't like going out much.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesSensorOptimization_Name
StringTable.String: Sensor Optimization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesSensorOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: A concentrated effort to optimize our sensor systems could lead to a number of different improvements.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesEnergyFieldFocus_Name
StringTable.String: Energy Field Focus

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesEnergyFieldFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: As is usually the case when equipment is sent to the field, the technicians who actually use it soon came up with a number of different ways to improve its efficiency and effectiveness.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesSensorMastery_Name
StringTable.String: Sensor Mastery

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesSensorMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: We don't anticipate any further increases in the viewing range of our sensors, not until we leave this universe for another one. But we can certainly make them a little more efficient.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesLifeSupportOptimization_Name
StringTable.String: Life Support Optimization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesLifeSupportOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: Everyone in the navy is very excited that we're trying to optimize our life support systems, and would certainly cheer if they weren't conserving their air.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesSupportFieldFocus_Name
StringTable.String: Support Field Focus

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesSupportFieldFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: Our early attempts at building field-based life support systems left behind many messes and many possible opportunities for improvement, which we're starting to identify now.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesLifeSupportMastery_Name
StringTable.String: Life Support Mastery

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesLifeSupportMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: We have all but mastered direct-nutrient injection technologies, and are wringing out a few additional efficiencies to reduce equipment size and cost.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesOrbitalSpecialization_Name
StringTable.String: Orbital Specialization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesOrbitalSpecialization_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we've watched a few construction projects accidentally collapse on themselves in orbit, we've identified a number of possible improvements in our existing construction techniques.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesZeroGravityOptimization_Name
StringTable.String: Zero Gravity Optimization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesZeroGravityOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: We took a big step forward with our most recent switch to zero-gravity construction practices, and after a few trial runs and one teensy little accident, our engineers have identified a number of areas for improvement.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesOrbitalConstructionFocus_Name
StringTable.String: Orbital Construction Focus

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesOrbitalConstructionFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: We're getting better and better at large scale construction with every passing day, and a number of more efficient design practices are beginning to show up on our engineers' drawing tables. Along with the pretty offensive doodles which have always been there.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesHullMastery_Name
StringTable.String: Hull Mastery

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesHullMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Our shipyards are already the envy of the civilized galaxy. But however great they are, they're still capable of more.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCarrierFocus_Name
StringTable.String: Carrier Focus

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCarrierFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: There's nothing like doing something a few times to see how much better it could be. A number of efficiencies in how we conduct our carrier operations have been made clear to us.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesLogisticalOptimization_Name
StringTable.String: Logistical Optimization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesLogisticalOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: A new generation of space accountants are becoming trained as we speak, capable of finding efficiencies and boring workers in any industry we choose.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesWeaponsSpecialization_Name
StringTable.String: Weapons Specialization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesWeaponsSpecialization_Dec
StringTable.String: By dedicating their efforts on a specific field of weapons technology, our researchers believe they can deliver a number of more effiicent weapon systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesBeamWeaponOptimization_Name
StringTable.String: Beam Weapon Optimization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesBeamWeaponOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: Weapons researchers have to keep pace with advances in many other fields to get the most out of their inventions. Right now, recent advances in material sciences are opening the door to a new generation of more efficient weapons.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesHighEnergyFocus_Name
StringTable.String: High Energy Focus

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesHighEnergyFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: A careful analysis of data returned from the field has revealed a number of inefficiencies which we can begin addressing in the next generation of our beam systems. We may also finally be able to get rid of that funny smell they make too.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesBeamWeaponMastery_Name
StringTable.String: Beam Weapon Mastery

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesBeamWeaponMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: We're now able to push our beam weapons right up to the limits that physics allow. If we want any more power, we may have to move to a different universe.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesMissileOptimization_Name
StringTable.String: Missile Optimization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesMissileOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: After blowing up several thousand target drones and one unfortunate asteroid, our weapons engineers have come up with a number of possible improvements we can implement for our missile platforms.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesWarheadFocus_Name
StringTable.String: Warhead Focus

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesWarheadFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: We've spent comparatively little research time on the warhead components of our missile systems, but now that we've turned our attention to the matter, a number of possible efficiencies should be able to be gained with a little effort.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPayloadMastery_Name
StringTable.String: Payload Mastery

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPayloadMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Various physical limits of this particular universe prevent us from wringing more destructive potential out of this generation of warheads. But we can certainly make them cheaper and lighter.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesKineticOptimization_Name
StringTable.String: Kinetic Optimization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesKineticOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: Some modest improvements in the energy delivery systems of our kinetic weapons could result in improvements to the cost, mass, or even the range of each unit.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesKineticAccelerationFocus_Name
StringTable.String: Kinetic Acceleration Focus

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesKineticAccelerationFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: Recent advances in superconducting technology should lead to improvements in the critical energy delivery systems of our kinetic weapons.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesKineticMastery_Name
StringTable.String: Kinetic Mastery

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesKineticMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: After several generations of whipping things at other things as fast as possible, our scientists are now really quite good at it. There remain but a few small efficiencies to wring out of the field.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDefensiveSpecialization_Name
StringTable.String: Defensive Specialization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDefensiveSpecialization_Dec
StringTable.String: Tasked with improving the survivability of our naval officers in combat situations, our engineer's first solution: "Don't enter combat situations," was less than helpful. So, after studying the wreckage of a few vessels we've lost in combat, they've come up with a number of possible improvements we can make in our defensive technologies.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesShieldOptimization_Name
StringTable.String: Shield Optimization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesShieldOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: We've received quite a bit of useful data on real world performance of our shield systems, and have devised several possible improvements we can begin making to them.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesBarrierSystemFocus_Name
StringTable.String: Barrier System Focus

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesBarrierSystemFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: A careful design review of our initial implementation of the Barrier Field system has revealed a number of possible avenues for further improvements. Who says design reviews are unexciting?

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesShieldMastery_Name
StringTable.String: Shield Mastery

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesShieldMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Our shielding technology approaches perfection. Our engineers now push the capabilities of our shield systems right to their theoretical limits.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseOptimization_Name
StringTable.String: Point Defense Optimization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesPointDefenseOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: Optimizing our point defense systems should lead to a number of different performance gains. Also importantly, less dead naval officers.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasureFocus_Name
StringTable.String: Counter Measure Focus

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesCounterMeasureFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: Now that we have some field data on ECM suite performance, we've identified a number of different ways we can improve upon the design and construction of those systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDroneSystemMastery_Name
StringTable.String: Drone System Mastery

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesDroneSystemMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Drone systems dramatically increased the sheer volume of our point defense capabilities, so any small improvement in their design we can make should lead to significant cost or weight savings.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorOptimization_Name
StringTable.String: Armor Optimization

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorOptimization_Dec
StringTable.String: We've blown up lots and lots of slabs of armor on the test range, and have come up with a few possible improvements we could make to our armor systems.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorFocus_Name
StringTable.String: Armor Focus

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorFocus_Dec
StringTable.String: Our armor systems have increased significantly in complexity. An increased effort to model their behavior under impact should help lead to more effective or efficient designs.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorMastery_Name
StringTable.String: Armor Mastery

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_PiratesArmorMastery_Dec
StringTable.String: Our mastery of hardening techniques is almost complete and the galaxy trembles at the girth of our vessels. But even perfection can be improved upon it seems. Some more effort should lead to cheaper or more efficient armor systems.
